resources.string: Malaysia\'s 1st international theme park is located in Johor Bahru, just across the causeway from Singapore.
Happening night bazaar offering stalls for clothing, trinkets, housewares and street food.
Desaru is a town in Pengerang, Kota Tinggi District. It is famous for its pristine beach beside the South China Sea.
The farm has been developed to contain more than 100 species of fruits trees and plants.
There are more than 1,000 of crocodile in this farm, including a toothless 130-year-old croc.
The mosque sits on top of a prominent hill, overlooking the Straits of Johor.
Jalan Tan Hiok Nee is a nice little heritage street to walk. Buy its banana cake which has a century of history.
Good place for briyani rice lover. The place is quite secluded. Mutton tastes superb, chicken sizable.
The food is delicious. A must try food while you are in JB. You can\'t get any better taste Kacang Pool anywhere else.
A simulacrum of dining in Melbourne cafe scene, with falling lights embellishing the quaint space.
The murtabak here has garnered the pride of putting together an irresistible Cheese Murtabak.
The soup embodies a gamy and herby punch and use the straw to seep out all those meaty goodness.
Frying up their deliciously crispy, soft and moist, signature pisang goreng comes with a side of spicy dipping sauce.
Onn Kitchen has a quaint Malay warong ambience, with a large tree growing at the front of the shop.
An outlet mall in Indahpura, Kulai District. It is the first luxury premium brand outlet in Southeast Asia.
Contemporary shopping center with 6 floors of brand-name stores, plus restaurants and a movie theater.
Scandinavian chain selling ready-to-assemble furniture, plus housewares, in a warehouse-like space.
Formerly known as Plaza Angsana, having recognised and awarded as ‘The most happening place in JB’.
Mall with diverse retail stores, beauty salons, massage services, a movie theater and casual eateries.
A shopping centre and office building in Wong Ah Fook Street, Johor Bahru, Johor, Malaysia.
The fast-expanding township of Bukit Indah, Johor. AEON\'s second largest mall in southern.
